item_0.description: Combine user-based and item-based collaborative filtering with content-based filtering for personalized recommendations, as seen in market leaders like Amazon and Salesforce Commerce Cloud

item_1.description: Implement service workers, offline caching, and app shell architecture to meet mobile-first expectations and compete with modern e-commerce platforms

item_2.description: Decouple frontend from backend using API-first approach to enable omnichannel experiences and future-proof the platform, aligning with industry trend toward composable commerce

item_3.description: Implement for product grids to improve page load speed and user experience, following mobile-first optimization best practices

item_0.suggestion: Implement real-time behavioral tracking and session-based personalization for guest users, not just registered customers
item_0.rationale: Industry leaders like Amazon provide personalized experiences immediately, without requiring login, increasing conversion rates

item_1.suggestion: Add semantic search capabilities, typo tolerance, and visual search (image-based) features
item_1.rationale: Modern e-commerce platforms are moving beyond keyword matching to understand user intent and provide more relevant results

item_2.suggestion: Incorporate social proof elements like user-generated content, reviews with images, and social sharing capabilities
item_2.rationale: Industry trends show growing importance of social commerce integration for building trust and driving conversions

item_3.suggestion: Implement CDN integration, image optimization, and critical CSS rendering for sub-2-second load times
item_3.rationale: Page speed is a critical factor for both user experience and SEO rankings, with industry standards requiring fast mobile performance

item_4.suggestion: Add BOPIS (Buy Online, Pickup In Store) and real-time inventory visibility across channels
item_4.rationale: Growing consumer expectation for flexible fulfillment options, as seen in industry trends toward omnichannel commerce

compliance_notes.item_4: Schema.org structured data implementation must follow latest standards for SEO and rich snippets
